targetString: سازمان جهانی صحت به مردم توصیه می کند از دست زدن به چشم، بینی یا دهان با دست های شسته نشده خودداری کنند.
en-mt: The World Health Organization advises people to refrain from touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: سطوح را می توان با شماری از محلول ها ضدعفونی کرد (یک دقیقه قرار گرفتن در معرض مواد ضدعفونی برای سطوح استیل ضد زنگ)، شامل ۶۲-۷۱٪ اتانول، ۵۰-۱۰۰٪ ایزوپروپانول، ۰.۱٪ هیپوکلریت سدیم ‏، ۰.۵٪ هایدروجن پروکسید و ۰.۲-۷.۵٪ پوویدون آیودین.
en-mt: Surfaces can be disinfected with a number of solutions (one minute exposure to disinfectants for stainproof steel surfaces), including 62-71% ethanol, 50-100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide and 0.2-7.5% povidon iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: راه حل های دیگر مانند بنزالکونیوم کلرید و کلروکسیدین گلوکونات اثر کمتری دارند.
en-mt: Other solutions such as benzalconium chlorid and chloroxidine gluconate have less effect.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: طبق توصیه سی دی سی، اگر فردی مشکوک به کووید است یا در مکانی مانند مطب یا مرکز معالجوی مرض او تأیید شده است، همه مناطق مانند مطب ها، سرویس های صحی، مناطق مشاع، تجهیزات الکترونیک مشترک مانند تبلت، نمایشگرهای لمسی، صفحه کلیدها، کنترول های از راه دور و ماشین های ای تی ام مورد استفاده مریضان هم باید گندزدایی شوند.
en-mt: According to the CDC's recommendation, if a person is suspected of covid-19 or has been confirmed in a place like his office or treatment center, all areas such as office, health services, common areas, common electronic equipment such as tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls and ATM machines used by patients should also be disinfected.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: سازمان های فعال در حوزه صحت به مردم توصیه کرده اند که هنگام سرفه کردن یا عطسه زدن، با دستمال یا آرنج خود جلوی دهان و بینی را بگیرند و بلافاصله دستمال کاغذی خود را دور بیندازند.
en-mt: Health organizations have advised people to stop the mouth and nose with their napkins or elbows when coughing or sneezing, and to immediately discard their paper towels.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: ماسک های جراحی برای افرادی که احتمالاً منتن شده اند توصیه می شود بخاطریکه ماسک می تواند حجم و مسافت پرتاب قطرات تنفسی هنگام صحبت کردن، عطسه و سرفه را کاهش دهد.
en-mt: Surgical masks are recommended for people who are likely to be minted because the mask can reduce the volume and distance of throwing respiratory drops when talking, sneezing and coughing.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: سازمان جهانی صحت، دستورالعمل هایی را در پیوند با زمان و چگونگی استعمال ماسک ها صادر کرده است.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has issued guidelines on when and how masks are used.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: طبق اظهارات استفان گریفین، ویروس شناس پوهنتون لیدز، "پوشیدن ماسک می تواند تمایل افراد برای لمس صورت خود که عامل اصلی انتقال انتان، با دست نشسته است را کاهش دهد." ماسک ها همچنان برای افرادی که از واقعات مشکوک به مرض مراقبت می کنند توصیه شده است.
en-mt: "Wearing masks can reduce people's willingness to touch their face, which is the main cause of transmission of enthane, by sitting by hand," according to Leeds University virologist Stephen Griffin.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: سازمان جهانی صحت به افراد سالم توصیه کرده است تنها در صورتی از ماسک استفاده کنند که مصاب خطر بلند قرار دارند، برای مثال از افراد مصاب کووید-۱۹ مراقبت می کنند، هرچند تأیید می کند که استعمال ماسک ممکن است کمک کند افراد صورت خود را لمس نکنند.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has advised healthy people to use masks only if they are at high risk, for example, taking care of people with COVID-19, although it confirms that mask use may help people not touch their faces.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: چندین کشور شروع به ترغیب عموم غرض استعمال از ماسک های صورت کرده اند.
en-mt: Several countries have begun to encourage the public to use face masks.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: در ایالات متحده، سی دی سی استعمال ماسک صورت غیر طبی تولید شده از پارچه را توصیه می کند. خاصتاً چین برای افراد سالم جامعه، به خصوص در تماس نزدیک ۱ متر (۳ فوت یا کمتر) با دیگر افراد توصیه به استعمال ماسک طبی یک بار مصرف دارد.
en-mt: In the United States, the CDC recommends the use of non-medical face masks produced from fabric. In particular, China recommends using disposable medical masks for healthy people in the community, especially in close contact with 1 meter (3 feet or less).

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: هانگ کانگ به استعمال ماسک جراحی در حمل و نقل عمومی یا مکان های شلوغ توصیه می کند.
en-mt: Hong Kong recommends the use of surgical masks on public transport or crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: مأمورین صحت تایلند در حال تشویق افراد برای تولید ماسک صورت پارچه ای در خانه و شستشوی یومیه آنها استند.
en-mt: Thai health officials are encouraging people to produce fabric face masks at home and wash them.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: جمهوری چکسلواکی رفتن در مکان های عمومی را بدون پوشیدن ماسک یا پوشاندن بینی و دهان ممنوع اعلان کرد.
en-mt: The Czechoslovak Republic banned going to public places without wearing masks or covering the nose and mouth.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: در ۱۶ مارچ، ویتنام از همه خواست تا در زمان حضور در اماکن عمومی، ماسک صورت بزنند تا از خود و دیگران محافظت کنند.
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam urged everyone to put on face masks while in public places to protect themselves and others.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: دولت اتریش پوشیدن ماسک را برای کسانی که وارد فروشگاه مواد غذایی می شوند، اجباری کرد.
en-mt: The Austrian government made it mandatory for those entering the grocery store to wear masks.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: اسرائیل از تمام شهروندان تقاضا کرده است هنگام حضور در مکان های عمومی از ماسک استفاده کنند.
en-mt: Israel has called on all citizens to use masks when they are in public places.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: تایوان که از اواسط مارچ به ظرفیت تولید ده ملیون ماسک در روز رسیده است، استعمال ماسک برای مسافرین ناوگان ریلی و اتوبوس های بین شهری را از ۱ اپریل ضروری کرده است.
en-mt: Taiwan, which has reached the capacity to produce 10 million masks a day since mid-March, has made it necessary to use masks for passengers of the rail fleet and intercity buses since April 1.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: در پاناما استعمال ماسک هنگام بیرون رفتن ضروری است و کسانی که نمی توانند ماسک صورت تهیه کنند باید در خانه ماسک تولید کنند.
en-mt: In Panama, masks are necessary when going out, and those who cannot make face masks must produce masks at home.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: ماسک های صورت به صورت گسترده ای در جاپان، کوریای جنوبی، مالیزیا و سینگاپور مورد استفاده قرار گرفتند.
en-mt: Face masks were widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia and Singapur.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: فاصله گذاری اجتماعی (همچنان بحیث فاصله گذاری فزیکی نیز شناخته می شود) شامل اقدامات کنترول انتان است که با هدف کاهش مرض ازطریق به حداقل رساندن تماس بین افراد اجرا می شود.
en-mt: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes anti-control measures aimed at reducing the disease by minimizing contact between individuals.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: روش ها شامل قرنطین ها؛ محدودیت های سفر؛ و رخصتی مکاتب، محل های کار، ورزشگاه ها، تئاترها یا مراکز خرید می باشند.
en-mt: Methods include quarantines, travel restrictions; and holidays for schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres or shopping malls.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: افراد با ماندن در خانه، محدود کردن مسافرت، اجتناب از مناطق شلوغ، استعمال احوال پرسی بدون تماس و رعایت فاصله خود با دیگران می توانند فاصله گذاری اجتماعی را رعایت کنند.
en-mt: People can observe social distance by staying at home, restricting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using contactless questioning and observing their distance from others.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: بسیاری از دولت ها در حال حاضر فاصله گذاری اجتماعی را در مناطق قرنطین شده که تحت تأثیر شیوع مرض قرار دارند، اجباری کرده اند یا توصیه می کنند.
en-mt: Many governments have already forced or recommended social dissociation in quarantined areas affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: حداکثر نفوس در اجتماعات که توسط نهادهای دولتی و سازمان های حوزه صحت در ایالات متحده آمریکا توصیه شده بود، به سرعت از ۲۵۰ نفر (در صورتی که موارد انتشار کووید-۱۹ در منطقه وجود نداشته باشد) به ۵۰ نفر و در ادامه به ۱۰ نفر کاهش پیدا کرد.
en-mt: The maximum population in communities recommended by government agencies and health organizations in the United States quickly decreased from 250 (if there were no COVID-19 emissions in the region) to 50 and then to 10.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: از تاریخ ۲۲ مارچ ۲۰۲۰، جرمنی اجتماع بیش از دو نفر را ممنوع اعلان کرد. کاهلان و افراد با امراض طبی مترافقه مانند دیابت، مرض قلبی، مرض تنفسی، فرط فشار خون و ضعف سیستم مدافه مصاب خطر زیاد این مرض حاد و اختلاطات آن قرار دارند و طبق توصیه سی دی سی باید در مناطق شیوع جمعی تا حد امکان در خانه بمانند. در اواخر مارچ ۲۰۲۰، سازمان جهانی صحت و دیگر مجامع صحی اصطلاح "فاصله گذاری اجتماعی" را با "فاصله گذاری فزیکی" تبدیل کردند تا مشخص شود مقصد از آن کاهش تماس فزیکی و در عین حال، حفظ ارتباطات اجتماعی مجازی یا از راه دور است.
en-mt: As of March 22, 2020, Germany banned the community of more than two people. Kahlan and people with synonymous medical diseases such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension and weakness of the modal system are at high risk of this acute disease and its mixing, and according to the CDC's recommendation, they should stay at home as much as possible in the areas of mass prevalence. In late March 2020, the World Health Organization and other health forums converted the term "social dissociation" with "physical distance" to determine that its destination was to reduce physical contact and, at the same time, maintain virtual or remote social connections.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: استفاده از اصطلاح "فاصله گذاری اجتماعی" این برداشت را متبادر کرده است که افراد باید در تجرید اجتماعی مکمل اشتراک کنند و نه آنکه آنها را ترغیب کند با دیگران ذریعه راه جایگزین در ارتباط باشند. برخی از مقامات رهنمودهای حفظ الصحه جنسی طی این پاندمی صادر کرده اند.
en-mt: The use of the term "social disconnection" has led to the perception that individuals should participate in complementary social experience and not encourage them to communicate with others in an alternative way. Some officials have issued sexual hygiene guidelines during the pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: این موارد شامل توصیه به داشتن رابطه جنسی محدود به شریک زندگی که علائم و نشانه های ویروس را نداشته باشد، می باشد.
en-mt: These include advising a partner who has no signs or symptoms of the virus.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: افراد مصاب کووید-۱۹ و افراد مشکوک به انتان، به خود- قرنطینی توصیه شده اند.
en-mt: Covid-19 patients and people suspected of being infected have been recommended self-quarantine.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: سازمان های صحی طرزالعمل های مفصلی برای خود-تجریدی مناسب ارائه کرده اند. بسیاری از دولت ها خود-قرنطین را برای همه جمعیت های باشنده مناطق منتن ضروری کرده یا توصیه نموده اند.
en-mt: Health organizations have provided detailed procedures for appropriate self-exodus. Many governments have required or recommended self-quarantine for all populations in the Menten areas.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: جدی ترین دستورات خود-قرنطین برای گروه های در معرض ریسک زیاد صادر شده اند.
en-mt: The most serious self-quarantine orders have been issued for high-risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: به افرادی که با فرد مصاب کووید-۱۹ در تماس بوده اند و افرادی که اخیراً به کشور یا منطقهٔ با شیوع گسترده سفر کرده اند، توصیه شده است که از زمان آخرین تماس احتمالی تا ۱۴ روز در خود-قرنطین باشند.
en-mt: People who have been in contact with covid-19 and those who have recently traveled to the country or region with widespread outbreaks have been advised to be in self-quarantine for up to 14 days since the last possible contact.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: ستراتیژی های کنترول شیوع یک مرض شامل اعمال محدودیت یا فرونشانی و کاهش نرخ شیوع استند.
en-mt: Strategies for controlling the prevalence of a disease include imposing restrictions or decommissioning and reducing the prevalence rate.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: اعمال محدودیت در مراحل اولیه شیوع صورت می گیرد و هدف از انجام آن ردیابی و تجرید افراد منتن و همچنان معرفی سایر اقدامات کنترول مرض و واکسیناسیون برای توقف انتشار مرض به سایر افراد است.
en-mt: Restrictions are imposed in the early stages of the outbreak and aim to track and extortion of individuals, as well as introduce other disease control and vaccination measures to stop the spread of the disease to other people.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: هنگامی که دیگر امکان وقایه شروع مرض وجود ندارد، تلاش ها به فاز کاهشی می روند: اقدامات انجام شده برای کاهش سرعت شیوع ویروس و کاهش آثار آن در سیستم صحت و جامعه است.
en-mt: When it is no longer possible to prevent the onset of the disease, efforts go to a decreasing phase: measures taken to slow down the spread of the virus and reduce its effects in the health system and society.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: ممکن است همزمان ترکیبی از اقدامات اعمال محدودیت و کاهشی اعمال شوند.
en-mt: A combination of restrictionand reduction measures may be applied at the same time.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: سرکوب مرض مستلزم تدابیر شدیدتری است تا نرخ تکثیر پایه پاندمی به کمتر از ۱ برسد. قسمتی از مدیریت پاندمی کاستن از اوج پاندمی است، که به آن صاف کردن منحنی اپیدمی هم گفته می شود.
en-mt: Suppression of the disease requires stricter measures to reduce the pandemic base proliferation rate to less than 1. Part of pandemic management is reducing the peak of the pandemic, also called smoothing the epidemic curve.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: این امر سبب کاهش ریسک بیش باری خدمات صحی می شود و زمان بیشتری را تا تولید واکسین و تداوی در اختیار قرار می دهد.
en-mt: This reduces the risk of health services and gives more time to produce vaccinations and treatments.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: مداخلات غیر دوایی که ممکن است شیوع ویروس را کنترول کنند شامل اقدامات پیش گیرانه شخصی، مانند حفظ الصحه دست، پوشیدن ماسک صورت و قرنطین است؛ اقدامات عمومی با هدف فاصله فزیکی مانند رخصتی مکاتب و لغو رویدادهای تجمعی؛ اشتراک عمومی برای تشویق پذیرش و اشتراک در چنین مداخلاتی؛ همچنان اقدامات محیطی نظیر تمیز کردن سطوح. قسمت اعظم اقدامات جدی با هدف مهار شیوع مرض در چین زمانی اجرا شد که شدت شیوع آن آشکار شد، مانند قرنطین کردن کل شهرها و ممنوعیت سفر.
en-mt: Non-repercussions that may control the virus outbreak include personal preemptive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face masks and quarantine; public measures aimed at physical distance such as school holidays and cancellation of cumulative events; public participation to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such as cleaning surfaces. Most serious measures aimed at curbing the outbreak in China were implemented when the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantine of entire cities and travel bans.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: دیگر کشورها نیز با هدف محدود کردن انتشار ویروس، اقدامات مختلفی پیش گرفتند.
en-mt: Other countries also took various measures to limit the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: کوریای جنوبی به سکریننگ عمومی و قرنطین های محلی روی آورد و نسبت به تردد و جابجایی افراد منتن هشدار داد.
en-mt: South Korea turned to public screening and local quarantines, warning of traffic and movement of mentors.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: سنگاپور برای واقعات منتن که خود را قرنطین کردند، حمایت مالی فراهم کرد و جریمه های سنگینی برای افرادی که قرنطین را نادیده گرفتند اعمال کرد.
en-mt: Singapore provided financial support for mentining incidents that quarantined itself and imposed heavy fines on people who ignored quarantine.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: تایوان تولید ماسک را افزایش داد و جریمه های سنگین برای احتکار تجهیزات طبی در نظر گرفت. شبیه سازی های انجام شده در رابطه با بریتانیه و ایالات متحده نشان داد کاهش اپیدمی (کند کردن و نه توقف سرعت اپیدمی) و فرونشانی (معکوس کردن سرعت اپیدمی) چالش های بزرگی به همراه دارند.
en-mt: Taiwan increased mask production and considered heavy fines for hoarding medical equipment. Simulations conducted in relation to britain and the United States showed that reducing the epidemic (slowing down and not stopping the epidemic speed) and substantiating (reversing the speed of the epidemic) pose major challenges.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: سیاست های تعدیل کننده بهینه ممکن است پیک تقاضای خدمات صحی را تا دو سوم و فوت را تا نصف کاهش دهند، اما همچنان منجر به صدها هزار مرگ و فراتر رفتن از ظرفیت سیستم های صحی می شوند.
en-mt: Optimal adjusting policies may reduce courier demand for health services by two-thirds and feet by half, but they continue to lead to hundreds of thousands of deaths and exceed the capacity of health systems.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: می توان سرکوب را در پیش گرفت، اما این کار باید تا زمانی که ویروس میان انسان ها در حال چرخش است ادامه داشته باشد (یا تا زمانی که واکسین ساخته شود، هرکدام که زودتر پیش آید)، در غیر این صورت هنگامی که کمی از اقدامات سخت گیرانه کاسته شود، ویروس دوباره اوج می گیرد و منتقل می شود.
en-mt: Suppression can be carried out, but this must continue until the virus is spinning among humans (or until the vaccine is made, whichever comes sooner), otherwise when a little of the strict measures are reduced, the virus peaks again and is transmitted.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: مداخله بلندمدت برای مقابله با پاندمی، مصارف اجتماعی و اقتصادی به همراه دارد.
en-mt: Long-term intervention to deal with pandemics has social and economic expenditures.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: هیچ دوای ضد ویروس خاصی برای کووید-۱۹ تأیید نشده است، اما تلاش هایی بشمول از آزمایش ادویه موجود در حال انجام است.
en-mt: No specific antiviral scans have been confirmed for COVID-19, but efforts are underway, including from existing spice testing.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: دریافت ادویه ضد ریزش بدون نیاز به نسخه، نوشیدن مایعات و استراحت می توانند در تسکین علائم مؤثر واقع شوند.
en-mt: Receiving anti-loss spices without the need for prescriptions, drinking fluids and resting can be effective in relieving symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: بسته به شدت، ممکن است تداوی با اکسیجن، مایعات داخل وریدی و تنفس کمکی ضرور باشد.
en-mt: Depending on the severity, oxygen treatment, intrunid fluids and auxiliary breathing may be necessary.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: استفاده از استروئیدها ممکن است اختلاطات مرض را تشدید کند.
en-mt: The use of steroids may exacerbate disease mixing.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: چندین ترکیب دوایی که سابقاً در تداوی دیگر امراض ویروسی مؤثر بودند، در حال بررسی غرض استعمال در تداوی کووید-۱۹ استند.
en-mt: Several drug compounds that were previously effective in the treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: سازمان جهانی صحت هم بیان کرد برخی "تداوی های خانگی و سنتی" می تواند عوارض ناشی از سارس-کووید-۱۹ را تقلیل دهند.
en-mt: The World Health Organization also stated that some "traditional and domestic treatments" can reduce complications from SARS-COVID-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: افزایش ظرفیت و اجرای مراقبت های صحی برای برطرف کردن نیازهای مریضان کووید-۱۹ از طرف سازمان جهانی صحت، یک اقدام اساسی غرض واکنش مقابل شیوع مرض توصیف شده است.
en-mt: Increasing the capacity and implementation of health care to meet the needs of COVID-19 patients has been described by the World Health Organization as a fundamental measure to react to the prevalence of the disease.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: مرکز اروپایی کنترول و وقایه مرض (ECDC) و دفتر منطقوی اروپایی سازمان جهانی صحت، دستورالعمل هایی را برای شفاخانه ها و خدمات صحی و معالجوی اولیه برای تبدیل منابع در سطوح مختلف بشمول از تمرکز خدمات لابراتواری به سمت تست کووید-۱۹، لغو پروسیجرهای انتخابی در صورت امکان، تجرید و قرنطین مریضان کووید-۱۹ مثبت و افزایش توانایی های مراقبت های ویژه با آموزش پرسنل و افزایش شمار ماشین های تهویه و بستر صادر کرده است.
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Control and Prevention (ECDC) and the World Health Organization's European Regional Office have issued guidelines for hospitals and health services and primary treatment to convert resources at various levels, including from focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling selective procedure if possible, expulsion and quarantine of covid-19 patients positive and increasing the capabilities of intensive care with training.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: نظریه های مختلفی در رابطه با هویت نخستین شخص مصاب (موسوم به مریض نمبر صفر) وجود دارد.
en-mt: There are different theories regarding the identity of the first infected person (known as patient no. 0).

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: اولین مورد شناخته شده از کروناویروس جدید ممکن است به ۱ دسمبر سال ۲۰۱۹ در ووهان‏، Hubei و چین برگردد.
en-mt: The first known case of the new coronavirus may go back to December 1, 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei and China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: طی یک ماه، به تدریج شمار واقعات منتن به کروناویروس در Hubei افزایش یافت.
en-mt: Within a month, the number of cases of coronavirus in Hubei gradually increased.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: اکثر این ها به بازار عمده فروشی غذاهای بحری هونان مربوط بودند که حیوانات زنده هم در آنجا به فروش می رفت و یک نظریه این است که این ویروس از این انواع حیوانات پیدا شده است؛ یا به عبارت دیگر، منشأ حیوانی (zoonotic) دارد. یک کلستر سینه و بغل (pneumonia) با عامل ناشناخته در ۲۶ دسمبر مشاهده شدند و تحت مداوای داکتر ژانگ جی ژیان در شفاخانه ولایتی هوبئی قرار گرفتند و این موضوع در ۲۷ دسمبر به مرکز کنترول امراض ژیانگان ووهان اطلاع داده شد.
en-mt: Most of these were related to the wholesale market of Hunan seafood, where live animals were also sold, and one theory is that the virus was found from these types of animals, or in other words, has a zoonotic origin. A chest and arm clostre (pneumonia) with an unknown agent was observed on December 26 and treated by Dr Zhang Ji Zhian at Hubei Provincial Hospital, where the matter was notified to wuhan's Lifegan Disease Control Centre on December 27.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: در ۳۰ دسمبر، گروهی از داکتران در شفاخانه مرکزی ووهان در پیوند با یک "کروناویروس شبه-سارس" به همکاران خود هشدار دادند.
en-mt: On December 30, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital warned colleagues of a "coronavirus-pseudo-SARS."

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: هشت تن از این داکتران بشمول از لی ونلیانگ برای گسترش شایعات کذب از طرف پولیس بازخواست شدند و داکتر دیگری، به نام آی فن، توسط مقامات مافوق خویش به دلیل بالابردن سطح هشدار توبیخ شدند.
en-mt: Eight of the doctors, including Li Wenliang, were questioned by police for spreading false rumors, and another doctor, Ifan, was reprimanded by his superior authorities for raising the alert level.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: کمیسیون صحت شاروالی ووهان بعداً در ۳۱ دسمبر یک اطلاعیه عمومی را منتشر کرد و به سازمان جهانی صحت اطلاع داد.
en-mt: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later issued a public announcement on December 31 and notified the World Health Organization.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: شمار قابل توجهی از واقعات منتن به سینه و بغل (pneumonia) ناشناخته در اوایل جنوری به مقامات صحی در ووهان گزارش شده که سبب شروع تحقیقات شده است. در مراحل اولیه شیوع، شمار واقعات تقریباً هر هفت و نیم روز، دو برابر شده است.
en-mt: A significant number of unknown pneumonia cases were reported to health authorities in Wuhan in early January, prompting an investigation. In the early stages of the outbreak, the number of incidents has doubled almost every seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: در اوایل و اواسط جنوری ۲۰۲۰، به واسطه رفت و آمدهای سال نو چینایی و این واقعیت که ووهان یکی از کانون های حمل و نقل و تقاطع خطوط اصلی ریلی است، ویروس به سایر ولایت های چین گسترش یافت.
en-mt: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces due to Chinese New Year commutes and the fact that Wuhan is one of the transport hubs and intersections of main rail lines.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: در تاریخ ۲۰ جنوری، چین از مصابیت تقریباً ۱۴۰ مورد جدید گزارش داد که شامل دو نفر در پکن و یک نفر در شنزن بودند.
en-mt: On January 20, China reported almost 140 new cases, including two in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: بعداً دیتای رسمی نشان می دهد که تا ۲۰ جنوری ۲۰۲۰، شمار ۶۱۷۴ نفر مصاب علائم مرض شده بودند. الی تاریخ ۲۶ مارچ، ایالات متحده با بلندترین شمار واقعات تأیید شده مرض در دنیا از چین و ایتالیا پیشی گرفت. الی تاریخ ۹ اپریل ۲۰۲۰، بیش از ۱.۶۱ ملیون مورد مرض در کل دنیا گزارش شد؛ بیش از ۹۷۰۰۰ نفر جان خود را از دست دادند و بیش از ۳۶۴۰۰۰ نفر بهبود یافتند.
en-mt: Later, official data shows that as of January 20, 2020, 6,174 people had been infected with symptoms. By March 26, the United States surpassed China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases of the disease in the world. As of April 9, 2020, more than 1.61 million cases of the disease were reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people died and more than 364,000 recovered.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: در حدود ۲۰۰ کشور و قلمرو، حداقل یک واقعه مصابیت گزارش شده است.
en-mt: In about 200 countries and territories, at least one incident of mistreatment has been reported.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: به علت پاندمی در اروپا، بسیاری از کشور ها در منطقه شنگن جابجایی آزاد را محدود کردند و کنترول مرزی ایجاد کردند.
en-mt: Because of the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen area restricted free movement and established border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: واکنش های ملی شامل اقدامات محدود کننده مانند قرنطین (تحت عناوینی چون دستورات ماندن در خانه، دستورات پناه گرفتن در خانه یا قرنطین کامل) و منع رفت و آمد است. الی تاریخ ۲ اپریل، تقریباً ۳۰۰ ملیون نفر در ایالات متحده یا حدود ۹۰ فیصد جمعیت تحت نوعی قرنطین خانگی استند، بیش از ۵۰ ملیون نفر در فیلیپین، حدود ۵۹ ملیون نفر در آفریقای جنوبی و۱.۳ ملیون نفر در هند در قرنطین مکمل خانگی استند.
en-mt: National reactions include restrictive measures such as quarantine (under titles such as stay-at-home orders, shelter orders or full quarantine) and curfews. As of April 2, approximately 300 million people in the United States, or about 90 percent of the population, are under some kind of home quarantine, more than 50 million in the Philippines, about 59 million in South Africa and 1.3 million in India are in home supplement quarantine.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: در ۲۶ مارچ، ۱.۷ ملیارد نفر در کل دنیا تحت نوعی از قرنطین قرار گرفتند، که دو روز بعد این عدد به ۲.۶ ملیارد نفر رسید، حدود یک سوم جمعیت دنیا.
en-mt: On March 26, 1.7 billion people worldwide underwent some kind of quarantine, which two days later reached 2.6 billion, about a third of the world's population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: نخستین مورد تأیید شده کووید-۱۹ به ۱ دسمبر ۲۰۱۹ در ووهان برمی گردد؛ گزارشی تأیید نشده حاکی از این است که نخستین مورد مربوط به ۱۷ نوامبر بود.
en-mt: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 dates back to December 1, 2019 in Wuhan; an unconfirmed report indicates that the first case was november 17.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: داکتر ژانگ جی ژیان، یک کلستر از مریضان مصاب پنومونی با دلیل نامشخص را در ۲۶ دسمبر تشخیص داد و بلافاصله در ۲۷ دسمبر، شفاخانه وی موضوع را به مرکز کنترول امراض جیانگ هان ووهان انعکاس داد.
en-mt: Dr Zhang Ji Zhian diagnosed a clostre of pneumonia patients with an unspecified reason on December 26 and immediately on December 27, his hospital echoed the matter to the Jianghan Wuhan Disease Control Centre.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: تست جنتیکی اولیه نمونه های مریضان در ۲۷ دسمبر ۲۰۱۹ نشان دهنده حضور کروناویروس شبه-سارس بود.
en-mt: The initial genetic test of patient samples on December 27, 2019 indicated the presence of coronavirus-sars.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: یک اطلاعیه عمومی توسط کمیسیون صحت شاروالی ووهان در تاریخ ۳۱ دسمبر صادر شد.
en-mt: A public announcement was issued by the Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on December 31.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: سازمان جهانی صحت در همان روز مطلع شد.
en-mt: The World Health Organization was notified on the same day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: با انتشار این اعلان ها، پولیس به داکتران ووهان در پیوند با "پخش شایعات" در پیوند با این اپیدمی هشدار داد.
en-mt: With the announcements released, police warned Wuhan doctors in connection with the "spread of rumors" in connection with the epidemic.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: کمیسیون صحت ملی چین در ابتدا ادعا کرد که "شواهد مشخصی" مربوط به انتقال مرض از انسان به انسان وجود ندارد.
en-mt: China's National Health Commission initially claimed there was "no specific evidence" related to the transmission of the disease from human to human.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: در اواخر جنوری، دولت چین یک کمپاین رادیکال را آغاز کرد که بعداً دبیرکل حزب کمونیست چین Xi Jinping، آن را بحیث "جنگ مردم" برای مهار شیوع ویروس توصیف کرد.
en-mt: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign, which Chinese Communist Party Secretary General Xi Jining later described as a "people's war" to contain the virus outbreak.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: در زمان رخداد آنچه که "کلانترین قرنطین تاریخ بشر" توصیف شده است، یک کمربند صحی در ۲۳ جنوری اعلان شد که ورود و خروج به/از ووهان را متوقف کرد و به ۱۵ شهر هوبئی تعمیم یافت و حدود ۵۷ ملیون نفر تحت تأثیر قرار گرفتند.
en-mt: At the time of what has been described as the "quarantine sheriffs of human history," a health belt was announced on January 23, halting entry and exit to/from Wuhan, and generalized to 15 Hubei cities, affecting about 57 million people.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: استفاده از خودروی شخصی در شهر ممنوع اعلان شد.
en-mt: The use of a private car in the city was banned.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: جشن های سال نوی چینایی (۲۵ جنوری) در بسیاری از مناطق تعطیل شدند.
en-mt: Chinese New Year celebrations (January 25) were closed in many areas.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: مقامات همچنان از ساخت یک شفاخانه موقت، شفاخانه Huoshenshan خبر دادند که طی ۱۰ روز به اتمام رسید.
en-mt: Authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huozenshah Hospital, which was completed within 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: پس از آن شفاخانه دیگری به نام شفاخانه Leishenshan نیز ساخته شد تا از مریضان اضافی مراقبت شود.
en-mt: Another hospital, Leishenshaan Hospital, was then built to take care of additional patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: علاوه بر شفاخانه های تازه اعمار شده، چین همچنان ۱۴ مرکز دیگر در ووهان مانند مراکز همایش و استادیوم ها را به شفاخانه های موقت تبدیل کرد. در ۲۶ جنوری، دولت تدابیر بیشتری برای مهار شیوع ‎کووید-۱۹، بشمول از صدور اظهارنامه های صحی برای مسافران و تمدید رخصتی جشنواره بهاره را اعمال کرد.
en-mt: In addition to newly built hospitals, China also turned 14 other centers in Wuhan, such as conference centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals. On January 26, the government imposed further measures to curb the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health statements for passengers and extending the spring festival holiday.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: پوهنتون ها و مکاتب نیز در سراسر کشور تعطیل شدند.
en-mt: Universities and schools were also closed across the country.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: مناطق هانگ کانگ و ماکائو چندین اقدام، خاصتاً در خصوص مکاتب و پوهنتون ها انجام دادند.
en-mt: The Hong Kong and Macau regions took several measures, particularly on schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: تدابیر دورکاری در چندین منطقه از چین اجرا شده اند.
en-mt: Teleworking measures have been implemented in several areas of China.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: محدودیت های مسافرت در درون و بیرون از ولایت هوبئی اعمال شدند.
en-mt: Travel restrictions were imposed in and out of Hubei province.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: حمل و نقل عمومی تبدیل یافته است و موزیم ها در سراسر چین طرز موقت تعطیل شده اند.
en-mt: Public transport has been transformed and museums across China have been temporarily shut down.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: کنترول رفت وآمد عمومی در بسیاری از شهر ها اعمال شد و تخمین زده می شود که حدود ۷۶۰ ملیون نفر (بیش از نصف جمعیت) با برخی انواع محدودیت های خارج از خانه مواجه شدند. بعد از آنکه این شیوع در ماه مارچ وارد فاز جهانی خود شد، مقامات چینایی اقدامات سختگیرانه ای برای جلوگیری از ورود ویروس از دیگر کشور ها انجام دادند.
en-mt: Public traffic control was imposed in many cities and it is estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some types of out-of-home restrictions. After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from entering from other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: برای مثال، پکن برای همه مسافرین بین المللی که به این شهر وارد می شوند قرنطین ۱۴ روزه اجباری در نظر گرفته است. در تاریخ ۲۳ مارچ، سرزمین اصلی چین فقط یک مورد مرض در داخل کشور داشت که پنج روز قبل تر ذریعه مسافری که از ولایتبول به گوانژو باز می گشت منتن شده بود.
en-mt: Beijing, for example, has considered mandatory 14-day quarantine for all international travelers arriving in the city. On March 23, mainland China had only one case of disease inside the country, which had been mined five days earlier by a passenger returning from Wilayatbol to Guangzhou.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: در ۲۴ مارچ ۲۰۲۰، لی که چیانگ، نخست وزیر چین، گزارش کرد که شیوع موارد سرایت در داخل کشور متوقف شده است و شیوع مرض در چین کنترول شده است.
en-mt: On March 24, 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the outbreak of contagion cases inside the country had stopped and that the outbreak had been controlled in China.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: در همان روز محدودیت های سفر در هوبئی به جز ووهان دو ماه پس از اجرای اجباری قرنطین کمتر شد. وزارت خارجه دولت چین در ۲۶ مارچ ۲۰۲۰ اعلان کرد که ورود به کشور برای باشندگان و افرادی که ویزا دارند از ۲۸ مارچ به بعد تعلیق می شود و کدام جزئیاتی از این که این سیاست چقدر ادامه خواهد داشت اعلان نشد.
en-mt: On the same day, travel restrictions in Hubei except Wuhan were reduced two months after mandatory quarantine was implemented. The Chinese government's foreign ministry announced on March 26, 2020 that entry to the country for residents and people with visas would be suspended from March 28 onwards, and no details of how long the policy would continue were announced.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: کسانی که قصد ورود به چین دارند باید در سفارت خانه ها یا کنسولگری های چین تقاضای ویزا بدهند.
en-mt: Those who intend to enter China must apply for visas at Chinese embassies or consulates.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: دولت چین صاحبان کسب و کار و کارخانه ها را تشویق کرده است که از ۳۰ مارچ شروع به فعالیت کنند و بسته های حمایت مالی برای شرکت ها در نظر گرفت. شورای ایالتی یک روز عزای عمومی اعلان کرد تا به صورت سکوت سه دقیقه ای ملی در ساعت ۱۰:۰۰ مورخ ۴ اپریل که با جشنواره کینگ مینگ همزمان می شد برگزار گردد، هرچند دولت مرکزی به صورت آنلاین از خانواده ها تقاضا کرد برای وقایه از موج تازه شیوع کووید-۱۹، فاصله گذاری فزیکی را رعایت کنند.
en-mt: The Chinese government has encouraged business owners and factories to start operating on March 30 and considered financial support packages for companies. The State Council announced a day of public mourning to be held as a three-minute national silence at 10:00 on April 4, which coincided with the King Ming Festival, although the central government online called on families to observe physical distance to prevent the new wave of covid-19 outbreaks.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: تأیید شد که کووید-۱۹ در ۲۰ جنوری سال ۲۰۲۰ از چین به کوریای جنوبی سرایت کرده است.
en-mt: Covid-19 was confirmed to have spread from China to South Korea on January 20, 2020.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: آژانس صحت و تداوی کشور از افزایش قابل توجه واقعات منتن تأیید شده در ۲۰ فبروری خبر داد، که بیشتر از تجمع در Daegu برای جنبش مذهبی جدید موسوم به کلیسای Shincheonji مسیح نشأت می گیرد.
en-mt: The country's health and treatment agency reported a significant increase in confirmed mentone incidents on February 20, mostly originating from a rally in Daegu for the new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Christ.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: حامیان شینچئونجی که با داگو از ووهان دیدار می کردند، مشکوک به منشأ ویروس استند.
en-mt: Supporters of Shincheonji, who were visiting With from Wuhan, suspect the origin of the virus.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: از ۲۲ فبروری، از میان ۹۳۳۶ نفر از پیروان کلیسا، علائم مرض در ۱۲۶۱ نفر یا حدود ٪۱۳ گزارش شد. کوریای جنوبی بلندترین سطح هشدار را در ۲۳ فبروری ۲۰۲۰ اعلان کرد.
en-mt: As of February 22, of the church's 9,336 followers, symptoms of the disease were reported in 1,261 people, or about 13%. South Korea announced the highest alert level on February 23, 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: در تاریخ ۲۸ فبروری، بیش از ۲۰۰۰ مورد تأیید شده مرض در کوریا گزارش شد که این رقم در تاریخ ۲۹ فبروری به ۳۱۵۰ مورد رسید.
en-mt: On February 28, more than 2,000 confirmed cases of the disease were reported in Korea, reaching 3,150 on February 29.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: پس از آنکه آزمایش کرونا ویروس سه عسگر مثبت گزارش شد، تمام پایگاه های نظامی کوریای جنوبی قرنطین شدند.
en-mt: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after the coronavirus test of three soldiers was reported positive.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: تقسیم اوقات پروازهای ایرلاین ها نیز تحت تأثیر قرار گرفت و به همین دلیل آنها نیز تبدیل کردند. پروگرام کوریای جنوبی بزرگترین و بهترین پروگرام سازمان یافته در جهان معرفی شده که در پیوند با سکریننگ جمعیت ازنظر ویروس و تجرید افراد منتن و همچنان ردیابی و قرنطین افرادی که با آنها در تماس بودند، موفق عمل کرده است.
en-mt: Airline flights were also affected, which is why they also converted. South Korea's program has been introduced as the largest and best organized program in the world, which has been successful in relation to population screening in terms of virus and expulsion of mentors, as well as tracking and quarantine of people who were in contact with them.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: روشهای سکریننگ شامل خودگزارش دهی اجباری علائم در پیوند با تازه واردان با پروازهای بین المللی ذریعه اپلیکیشن های مبایل، آزمایش های سواره برای ویروس که نتایج آن در روز بعد مشخص می شود و افزایش قابلیت آزمایش تا ۲۰۰۰۰ نفر در هر روز است.
en-mt: Screening methods include mandatory self-reporting of symptoms associated with newcomers with international flights using mobile apps, ride tests for the virus, the results of which will be determined the next day, and an increase in testing capability of up to 20,000 people per day.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: پروگرام کوریای جنوبی با وجود عدم قرنطین کل شهرها، موفقیتی در کنترول شیوع این مرض محسوب می شود. در ابتدا جامعه کوریای جنوبی در واکنش رئیس جمهور Moon Jae-in به این بحران، دوقطبی شد.
en-mt: South Korea's program is a success in controlling the outbreak despite the lack of quarantine of entire cities. Initially, South Korean society became bipolar in President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: شمار زیادی از شهروندان کوریا طوماری برای اعلان جرم علیه مون به دلیل آنچه سوء مدیریت دولتی در مدیریت شیوع مرض می دانند امضا کردند، در حالیکه برخی دیگر با امضاء خود به تمجید از واکنش او پرداختند.
en-mt: A large number of Koreans signed a petition to declare a crime against Moon for what they consider to be mismanagement of the outbreak, while others praised his reaction.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: گزارش شده است که کوریای جنوبی در تاریخ ۲۳ مارچ، کمترین مجموع واقعات منتن در یک روز در طول چهار هفته را داشت.
en-mt: South Korea was reported to have the lowest total number of mentone incidents in a day over four weeks on March 23.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: در ۲۹ مارچ گزارش شد که از اول اپریل همه تازه واردان به کشور از خارج، به مدت دو هفته قرنطین می شوند.
en-mt: On March 29, it was reported that from April 1, all newcomers to the country from abroad would be quarantined for two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: طبق گزارش های رسانه ها در ۱ اپریل، کوریای جنوبی از طرف ۱۲۱ کشور تقاضا کمک برای تست ویروس دریافت کرده است.
en-mt: South Korea has received requests for help testing the virus from 121 countries, according to media reports on April 1.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: ایران اولین واقعات تأیید شده انتان SARS-CoV-2 را در ۱۹ فبروری در قم اعلان کرد که آنجا طبق نظر وزارت صحت و آموزش طبی دو نفر در همان روز فوت شدند.
en-mt: Iran announced the first confirmed incidents of ANTAN SARS-CoV-2 on February 19 in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died on the same day.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: اقدامات اولیه اعلان شده از سوی دولت شامل لغو کنسرت ها و سایر رویدادهای فرهنگی، مسابقات ورزشی و نماز جمعه و رخصتی پوهنتونها، مؤسسات آموزش عالی و مکاتب بود.
en-mt: Initial measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sports competitions and Friday prayers, and holidays for universities, higher education institutions and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: ایران ۵ تریلیون ریال را به مبارزه با این ویروس تخصیص داد.
en-mt: Iran allocated 5 trillion rials to fight the virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: رئیس جمهور حسن روحانی در ۲۶ فبروری ۲۰۲۰ اظهار داشت طرحی برای قرنطین مناطق منتن به شیوع ویروس در دست نیست و تنها می بایست افراد قرنطین شوند.
en-mt: On February 26, 2020, President Hassan Rouhani stated that there was no plan to quarantine the areas of Menten to the outbreak of the virus and that only individuals should be quarantined.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: طرح هایی برای محدود کردن مسافرت برون شهری در ماه مارچ اعلان شد، با آنهم، ترافیک سنگین بین شهرهای کشور قبل از سال نوی ایرانی ادامه داشت.
en-mt: Plans to restrict overseas travel were announced in March, with heavy traffic between cities in the country continuing before the Iranian New Year.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: حرم های مقدس شیعیان در شهر قم تا ۱۶ مارچ ۲۰۲۰ برای زائرین باز بودند. ایران به مرکز گسترش ویروس پس از چین در ماه فبروری تبدیل شد.
en-mt: Holy Shiite shrines in the city of Qom were open to pilgrims until March 16, 2020. Iran became the center of the spread of the virus after China in February.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: در میان ادعاهای سر پوش گذاشتن در پیوند با میزان شیوع این ویروس در ایران، بیش از ده کشور واقعات منتن خود را تا ۲۸ فبروری به ایران نسبت داده اند، که نشان می دهد میزان شیوع این ویروس ممکن است شدیدتر از ۳۸۸ موردی باشد که دولت ایران تا آن تاریخ گزارش کرده است.
en-mt: Amid allegations of cover-ups related to the prevalence of the virus in Iran, more than a dozen countries have attributed their mentone cases to Iran by February 28, suggesting that the prevalence of the virus may be more severe than the 388 reported by the Iranian government to that date.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: مجلس ایران تعطیل شد و ۲۳ نفر از ۲۹۰ عضو آن گزارش دادند که در ۳ مارچ، آزمایش ویروس آنان، مثبت بوده است.
en-mt: Iran's parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reporting that on March 3, their virus test was positive.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: در تاریخ ۱۲ مارچ، ناظر حقوق بشر به مقامات زندان ایران تأکید کرد که مدافعان حقوق بشر بازداشت شده برای اختلاف نظر مسالمت آمیز را بدون قید و شرط آزاد کنند و همچنان همه زندانیان واجدالشرایط را به صورت موقت آزاد کنند.
en-mt: On March 12, the Human Rights Watch urged Iranian prison authorities to release detained human rights defenders for peaceful disagreement unconditionally, as well as temporarily release all eligible prisoners.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: اظهار شده است در محیط های بسته مانند مراکز بازداشتگاه که فاقد خدمات مراقبت طبی مناسب نیز استند، خطر انتشار ویروس بلندتر است.
en-mt: It has been stated that in closed environments such as detention centers that also lack proper medical care services, the risk of spreading the virus is higher.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: در ۱۵ مارچ، دولت ایران ۱۰۰ مورد فوت در یک روز را گزارش کرد که بیشترین میزان ثبت در کشور از زمان شیوع این مرض بوده است.
en-mt: On March 15, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a day, the highest recorded in the country since the outbreak.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: فوت حداقل ۱۲ سیاستمدار و مسئول دولت فعال یا اسبق ایران الی تاریخ ۱۷ مارچ اعلان شد.
en-mt: The deaths of at least 12 politicians and officials of iran's active or former government were announced by March 17.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: تا ۲۳ مارچ، ایران هر ساعت ۵۰ مورد مریض جدید و یک مورد مرگ ناشی از کروناویروس داشت.
en-mt: As of March 23, Iran had 50 new cases and one coronavirus-related death every hour.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: به گفته یک مقام سازمان صحت جهانی، ممکن است واقعات منتن در ایران، پنج برابر بیشتر از آنچه که گزارش شده، باشد.
en-mt: According to a World Health Organization official, the incidents in Iran may be five times higher than reported.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: همچنان پیشنهاد شده است که تحریم های ایالات متحده بر علیه ایران ممکن است بر توانایی مالی این کشور برای واکنش مناسب نسبت به شیوع ویروس تأثیر منفی داشته باشد.
en-mt: It has also been suggested that U.S. sanctions against Iran may have a negative impact on the country's financial ability to react appropriately to the virus outbreak.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: کمیساریای عالی حقوق بشر سازمان ملل متحد خواستار کاهش فشارهای اقتصادی بر کشورهایی است که بیشتر از همه درگیر این مرض استند، بشمول از ایران.
en-mt: The UNHCR is calling for a reduction in economic pressures on countries most involved in the disease, including From Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: در تاریخ ۳۱ جنوری همزمان با مثبت اعلان شدن آزمایش مصابیت دو توریست چینایی به SARS-CoV-2 در رُم، شیوع مرض در ایتالیا تأیید شد.
en-mt: On January 31, the outbreak in Italy was confirmed at the same time as the positive test for the mistreatment of two Chinese tourists to SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: فقرات منتن به سرعت افزایش یافتند و این امر دولت ایتالیا را بر آن داشت تا پرواز‎های ورودی و خروجی چین را معوق نماید و وضعیت ایمرجنسی اعلان کند.
en-mt: Menten's spine quickly increased, prompting the Italian government to deferre china's incoming and outbound flights and declare emergency status.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: یک کلستر نامرتبط از واقعات کووید-۱۹ بعداً کشف شد که از ۱۶ مورد تأیید شده در لومباردی در ۲۱ فبروری شروع شد. در ۲۲ فبروری، شورای وزیران، از تصویب یک قانون جدید برای مهار شیوع این مرض خبر دادند، که شامل قرنطین کردن بیش از ۵۰۰۰۰ نفر در ۱۱ بخش مختلف در شمال ایتالیا می شود.
en-mt: An unrelated closter of COVID-19 incidents was later discovered, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on February 21. On February 22, the Council of Ministers announced the passage of a new law to curb the outbreak, which includes quarantine of more than 50,000 people in 11 different parts of northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: نخست وزیر، جوزپه کونته گفت "در مناطق شیوع مرض، ورود و خروج ممنوع است.
en-mt: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said "in areas of outbreaks, entry and exit are prohibited.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: قبلاً دستورات لازم نسبت به تعلیق فعالیت های کاری و رویدادهای ورزشی در این نواحی صادر شده است. "در ۴ مارچ، پس از رسیدن تلفات به ۱۰۰ نفر در ایتالیا، دولت دستور داد تمامی مکاتب و پوهنتون ها در سراسر کشور طرز مکمل تعطیل شوند.
en-mt: Previously, necessary orders have been issued to suspend work activities and sporting events in these areas. "On March 4, after casualties reached 100 in Italy, the government ordered all schools and universities across the country to be closed in full.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: تمامی مسابقات ورزشی مهم بشمول از مسابقات فوتبال سری A ‎، تا ماه اپریل پشت درهای بسته برگزار شدند، اما در ۹ مارچ، تمامی ورزش ها به مدت یک ماه به حالت تعلیق درآمدند.
en-mt: All important sports competitions, including the Serie A football tournament, were held behind closed doors until April, but on March 9, all sports were suspended for a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: در روز ۱۱ مارچ، نخست وزیر کنت دستور توقف تقریباً تمامی فعالیت های تجارتی به جز سوپرمارکت ها و فارمسی ها را صادر کرد. روز ۶ مارچ، کالج بیهوشی ایتالیا، بی حسی، احیا و مراقبت های ویژه (SIAARTI)، توصیه نامه های اخلاق طبی را در رابطه با پروتوکول های سه گانه که ممکن است به کار گرفته شوند، منتشر کرد.
en-mt: On March 11, Prime Minister Kent ordered a halt to almost all business activities except supermarkets and pharmacies. On March 6, the Italian College of Anesthesia, Anesthesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAHARTI), published medical ethics recommendations on triad protocols that may be employed.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: در روز ۱۹ مارچ، ایتالیا از حیث بلندترین تلفات ناشی از کرونا در جهان با گزارش ۳۴۰۵ کشته در یک روز بر اثر پاندمی از چین پیشی گرفت.
en-mt: On March 19, Italy surpassed China as the world's highest coronavirus death toll, with 3,405 deaths reported in a day as a result of the pandemic.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: در ۲۲ مارچ، گزارش شد که روسیه نُه طیاره نظامی شامل تجهیزات طبی به ایتالیا اعزام کرده است.
en-mt: On March 22, Russia was reported to have deployed nine military aircraft, including medical equipment, to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: از ۵ اپریل، ۱۲۸۹۴۸ مورد تأییدشده، ۱۵۸۸۷ مورد فوت و ۲۱۸۱۵ بهبودی در ایتالیا رخ داده است که اکثر این واقعات در منطقه Lombardy رخ داده است.
en-mt: Since April 5, 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths and 21,815 improvements have occurred in Italy, most of which occurred in the Lombardy region.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: گزارشی از سی ان ان مشخص کرد که ترکیب دو عامل نفوس کاهل ایتالیا و ناتوانی برای تست همه افرادی که تا به امروز مصاب ویروس بوده اند، می تواند سبب نرخ بلند فوت شده باشد.
en-mt: A report by CNN found that the combination of two factors in Italy's kahl population and the inability to test all people who have been infected with the virus to date could have caused high death rates.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: واکنش انگلیس بالای ویروس، در ابتدا به صورت یکی از خونسردترین کشورهای آسیب دیده بازتاب داده شد و تا ۱۸ مارچ سال ۲۰۲۰، دولت انگلیس کدام شکلی از فاصله گذاری اجتماعی یا اقداماتی برای قرنطین جمعی را بر شهروندان خود تحمیل نکرد.
en-mt: The UK's reaction to the virus was initially reflected as one of the coldest affected countries, and until March 18, 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social dissociacy or measures for collective quarantine on its citizens.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: نتیجتاً، دولت به خاطر عدم بکارگیری سرعت عمل و جدیت در پاسخ به نگرانی های عموم مورد انتقاد قرار گرفت. در ۱۶ مارچ، نخست وزیر بوریس جانسون، در سخنرانی خود مسافرت غیرضروری و ارتباط اجتماعی را منع کرد و از مردم خواست در صورت امکان از خانه کار انجام دهند و از رفتن به محل هایی مانند بارها، رستورانت ها و سینما ها خودداری کنند.
en-mt: As a result, the government was criticized for failing to use the speed of action and seriousness in response to public concerns. On March 16, Prime Minister Boris Johnson banned unnecessary travel and social communication in his speech, urging people to do work from home if possible and to refrain from going to places such as bars, restaurants and cinemas.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: در ۲۰ مارچ، دولت اعلان کرد همه مراکز تفریحی از قبیل میخانه ها و سالن های ورزشی می بایست در اسرع وقت تعطیل شوند و وعده داد تا ۸۰ فیصد حقوق کارکنان آنها را تا سقف ۲۵۰۰ دالر استرالیا در ماه پرداخت خواهد کرد تا از افزایش بیکاری در این بحران جلوگیری نماید. در ۲۳ مارچ، نخست وزیر اعلان کرد معیارهای فاصله گذاری اجتماعی سختگیرانه تری اعمال شوند، از اجتماعات بیش از دو نفر جلوگیری شود و مسافرت و فعالیت خارج از منزل تا اندازه ای که واقعاً ضرورت دارد محدود شود.
en-mt: On March 20, the government announced that all recreational centres, such as pubs and gyms, should be closed as soon as possible and promised to pay 80% of their staff salaries up to 2,500 Australian dollars a month to prevent unemployment from rising in the crisis. On March 23, the Prime Minister announced stricter social dissection criteria to be applied, preventing gatherings of more than two people and limiting travel and activities abroad to the extent that it really needs to be.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: این محدودیت ها برخلاف اقدامات قبلی، از جانب پولیس و ذریعه صدور جریمه و پراکنده کردن اجتماعات قابل اجرا است.
en-mt: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions are enforceable by the police and by issuing fines and dispersing communities.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: دستور رخصتی اکثر کسب وکارها داده شد، به جز موارد استثنا برای کسب وکار هایی که "ضروری" تلقی می شدند، بشمول از سوپرمارکت ها، فارمسی ها، بانک ها، اسباب فروشی ها، پمپ بنزین ها و گاراژها.
en-mt: Most businesses were ordered to take holidays, except for exceptions for businesses deemed "essential," including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, toys, petrol stations and garages.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: در ۲۰ جنوری، اولین مورد از کووید-۱۹ در ایالت شمال غربی پسیفیک در واشنگتن در مردی شناسایی و تأیید شد که در ۱۵ جنوری از ووهان بازگشته بود.
en-mt: On January 20, the first case of COVID-19 in the northwestern Pacific state of Washington was identified and confirmed in a man who had returned from Wuhan on January 15.

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: کارگروه کروناویروس کاخ سفید در ۲۹ جنوری تأسیس شد.
en-mt: The White House Coronavirus Working Group was established on January 29.

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: در ۳۱ جنوری، دولت ترامپ وضعیت ایمرجنسی صحت عامه اعلان کرد و محدودیت هایی برای مسافرین ورودی از چین برقرار نمود.
en-mt: On January 31, the Trump administration announced a public health emergency and imposed restrictions on incoming passengers from China.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: در ۲۸ جنوری ۲۰۲۰، مرکز کنترول مرض ها، انستیتوی صحت عامه پیشرو در دولت ایالات متحده اعلان کرد آنها کیت تست مخصوص خود را ساخته اند.
en-mt: On January 28, 2020, the Center for Disease Control, the leading U.S. government public health institute, announced that they had built their own test kit.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: علیرغم انجام این کار، آمریکا در امر تست گرفتن شروع کُندی داشت، که میزان شیوع واقعی این ویروس اپیدمی را در سایه ابهام قرار داد.
en-mt: Despite doing so, the U.S. had a slow start in testing, which put the true prevalence of the epidemic virus in the shadow of ambiguity.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: به دلیل کیت های تست معیوب، که توسط دولت فدرال در فبروری تولید شده است، به دلیل عدم تأیید کیت های آزمایشی غیر دولتی، توسط دولت فدرال (توسط جامعه پوهنتونی، شرکت ها و شفاخانه ها) تا پایان فبروری و معیارهای محدود کننده برای افراد واجد شرایط انجام آزمایش، آزمایشات انجام شده تا اوایل ماه مارچ (دستور داکتر لازم بود) خراب و نامعتبر شمرده شدند.
en-mt: Due to faulty testing kits, produced by the federal government in February, tests conducted by early March (doctor's orders were required) were corrupted and invalid by the federal government (by the university community, companies and hospitals) until the end of February and restrictive criteria for eligible people to conduct testing.

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: تا ۲۷ فبروری، واشنگتن پست گزارش کرد کمتر از ۴۰۰۰ تست در ایالات متحده انجام شده است.
en-mt: As of February 27, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: آتلانتیک تا ۱۳ مارچ، گزارش داد که کمتر از ۱۴۰۰۰ آزمایش انجام شده است.
en-mt: As of March 13, The Atlantic reported that fewer than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
